==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}
[[File:Barley ear, backlit 1.jpg|thumb|200px|Barley ear.]]

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|禾|乃|ls=p|t1=plant}}, resembling a fruit/an ear hanging off a plant.

===Etymology===
May be a causative of {{och-l|褎|growth of seedlings}}. Compare {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*m-loh||to blossom}} (whence {{cog|vi|trổ||to burst, to open, to display}}, {{m|vi|lổ||naked}}), and {{cog|km|លាស់||to grow, to blossom, to prosper}}.

The meaning of “show” [noun] is a {{zh-psm|show|nocap=1}}.

#* {{zh-x|實 種{zhòng} 實 褎，實 發 實 '''秀'''。|Then he used it as seed, and it sprang up; It grew and '''came into ear'''.|CL|ref=Shijing}}
# {{†}} {{lb|zh|of plants}} to [[bear]] [[fruit]]
